edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.user.schedule

Class Schedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.user.schedule.Schedule

  • public class Schedule
extends java.lang.Object
    Gives a student the ability to track what courses they have scheduled, as well as, the ability to add, remove, and replace the courses within their schedule, and the ability to rename the schedule's title.
    Author:
    Steven Mayo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Schedule()
      Constructs the Schedule object, which is used to keep track of what Courses the Student has scheduled.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      boolean addCourseToSchedule(Course c)

      Checks to see if a Course can be added to a student's schedule.
      int getScheduleCredits()
      Returns the total number of credits within the student's schedule.

      Returns an 2D ArrayList of the student's schedule with one course per row and columns for the name, section, and title.

      Getter method to return the schedule's title.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Schedule

        public Schedule()
        Constructs the Schedule object, which is used to keep track of what Courses the Student has scheduled. The title is set to a default of "My Schedule" and an empty array list is created to hold Course objects.

    • Method Detail

      • addCourseToSchedule

        public boolean addCourseToSchedule(Course c)
        Attempts to add a course to the student's schedule, but does not allow duplicate or invalid courses.
        Parameters:
        c - The course to be added to the schedule.
        Returns:
        true if the course can be added or false if not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a course has the same name as one already in the students schedule. An exception is also thrown if the Course time conflicts with a previously scheduled activity.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the course parameter is null.

      • removeCourseFromSchedule

        public boolean removeCourseFromSchedule(Course c)
        Removes a course from the student's schedule. The course to be removed is passed in as a parameter, which will conditionally trigger a boolean return value.
        Parameters:
        c - The course to be removed from the student's schedule.
        Returns:
        True if the course was removed.

      • resetSchedule

        public void resetSchedule()
        Resets the user's schedule, but keeps the current title.

      • getScheduledCourses

        public java.lang.String[][] getScheduledCourses()
        Returns an 2D ArrayList of the student's schedule with one course per row and columns for the name, section, and title.
        Returns:
        schedule2d String[][] containing a Course per row with the name, title, and section in separate columns. into columns. If the schedule is empty, an empty String[][] is returned.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Rename's the student's schedule to that of the passed in String parameter.
        Parameters:
        title - The new title of the schedule
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the new title is null or empty.

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Getter method to return the schedule's title.
        Returns:
        The current title of the schedule.

      • getScheduleCredits

        public int getScheduleCredits()
        Returns the total number of credits within the student's schedule.
        Returns:
        totalCredits the total number of credits scheduled.

      • canAdd

        public boolean canAdd(Course c)
        Checks to see if a Course can be added to a student's schedule. If the course is null, already present in the schedule, or has a time conflict with another course, then false is returned.
        Parameters:
        c - Course to check if available to add to schedule.
        Returns:
        True if the course can be added to the student's schedule.
